de.espirit.firstspirit.access.editor.value.DomNode

    de.espirit.firstspirit.access.editor.value  

    • Uses of DomNode in de.espirit.firstspirit.access.editor.value

      Subinterfaces of DomNode in de.espirit.firstspirit.access.editor.value 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      interface  DefaultDomNode
      Node of DomElement content.
      interface  LinkDomNode
      A dom node representing a link.
      interface  ListDomNode
      A dom node representing a list.
      interface  TableCell
      Instances represents the cells of a table.
      Since 4.2.17 a table cell extends the interface DomNode.
      interface  TableDomNode
      A dom node representing a table.
      interface  TableRowDomNode
      A dom node representing a table row of a table.
      interface  TextDomNode
      A dom node representing text content.
      Methods in de.espirit.firstspirit.access.editor.value that return DomNode 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      DomNode DefaultDomNode.appendChild​(FormatTemplate formatTemplate)
      Creates and appends a child at the end of the child list.
      DomNode DomNode.getFirstChild()
      Returns the first child node or null if there is no such node.
      DomNode DomNode.getNextSibling()
      Returns the next sibling node or null if there is no such node.
      DomNode DomNode.getParent()
      Returns the parent node or null if this node is a root node.
      DomNode DomNode.replaceChild​(DomNode child, String text)
      Replace a child with a new one at the same position the child list.
      Methods in de.espirit.firstspirit.access.editor.value that return types with arguments of type DomNode 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Iterable<DomNode> DomNode.getChildren()
      Returns all direct child nodes.
      Iterable<DomNode> DomNode.getChildren​(boolean recursive)
      Returns children, maybe recursivly.
      Methods in de.espirit.firstspirit.access.editor.value with parameters of type DomNode 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void DomNode.removeChild​(DomNode child)
      Removes a child of the child list.
      DomNode DomNode.replaceChild​(DomNode child, String text)
      Replace a child with a new one at the same position the child list.
